page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This area is mainly agricultural with two villages, Upper Gravenhurst and part of Silsoe, the hamlet of Lower Gravenhurst , Wrest Park, Cainhoe Manor, the Mill near Gravenhurst and several scattered farms. The land is mainly heavy clay soil on rolling hills and valleys with small woods and copses here and there. The young River Flit runs through the valley at the extreme eastern edge of the block, and small streams join it at intervals. Roads are winding and narrow except for the A6 by-pass Luton to Bedford, round Silsoe. Although there is no part of great beauty, the area is pleasantly rural, a quiet and peaceful place in which to live and work. Public transport is not frequently available so most inhabitants rely on using their own cars. The area is typical example of rural Bedfordshire.
